alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 19 at 2:44AM MDT until March 23 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches except between 16 and 28 inches above 8500 feet in the Tusas Mountains. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph on Tuesday and Wednesday. * WHERE...Northern and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Chuska Mountains, Tusas Mountains Including Chama, and Jemez Mountains. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed and icy road conditions, especially over higher mountain passes. Travel may be very difficult to impossible between Chama and Tres Piedras. Road closures may occur. Gusty winds and wet snow could bring down tree branches and lead to power outages.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Chuska Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama
